markdownRemark.html:
So here’s my new blog! It’s built on Gatsby, which is a whole progressively-enhanced, React powered static site generator song and dance.

I’d been using my previous Wordpress dot com-based blog since August 2012, which is seven years ago at the time of this writing. Seven years is a long time for a website. I started it in college, and I kept it through a significant chunk of my professional career. I’ll keep it up for now

I didn’t come to blogging from a tech background. I started my earliest blog on Blogspot around 2005, when I was 13. I enjoyed writing and sharing my thoughts with my mom and her grad student friends. It was very nice of them to humor me. I wasn’t very cool, but I deeply craved their respect.

Here’s a screenshot from my earliest extant blog, which is still hosted on Blogspot:

There used to be a post containing the first chapter of my fantasy adventure book, but it looks like I deleted it at some point. I am sad about that.

Anyways,

This is the third major blogging platform era for me. I am switching over because I want to have finer control over the look and feel. The previous blog was very dated and didn’t suit my needs very well. Although I could have spent time choosing a more appropriate theme, I want to use tools which I’ve already invested in (e.g. React, JavaScript), rather than learning a big new toolset as Wordpress would require.

Also, I wanted it to be on my own domain, hosted for free by Github Pages like the rest of my site. This is just a super easy way of making that happen.

frontmatter.title: Switching to Gatsby
frontmatter.description: I'm doing a new blog with Gatsby.
